summary: This is an email update from August 13, 2019, summarizing voluntary interviews conducted by the OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019. It details failures in protocol, including missed inmate counts and non-functional cameras, and notes that several key officers refused to be interviewed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The document details the discovery of his body and the circumstances leading up to his death in the SHU.

persons.name: U Anderson
persons.context: The outgoing operations lieutenant at MCC who was relieved by the interviewing lieutenant on the morning Epstein's body was discovered.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email update, summarizing the interview findings for the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Anderson was the operations lieutenant responsible for overseeing prison operations during his shift prior to the discovery of Epstein's death.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. An operations lieutenant responded to a medical call and found Epstein on the ground with an officer performing CPR.

events.title: Epstein's Last Phone Call
events.description: An MCC officer assisted Epstein in making an unrecorded legal phone call from the SHU showers. Epstein stated he was calling his mother but was overheard making small talk with a male individual.

events.title: Voluntary Interviews of MCC Staff
events.description: The OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with several MCC employees regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death, uncovering protocol failures.

keyFacts: Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell on the morning of August 10, 2019; he was supposed to have a cellmate but did not overnight.
MCC staff admitted to failing to conduct mandatory inmate counts at 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. prior to Epstein's death.
The camera system in the SHU was not working at the time of Epstein's death, and some senior staff were unaware of this.
Several key officers, including those who discovered Epstein's body, refused to speak with investigators without their union representatives.
Epstein had made an unrecorded legal phone call a day before his death, facilitated by an MCC officer who dialed the number for him.
